item.title: Linux Kernel Capabilities Explained
item.description:
Traditionally, Linux Kernel distinguishes its processes with the following

two categories:

  • Privileged Processes: These processes allow the user to bypass all Kernel permission checks.

  • Unprivileged Processes: These processes are subject to full permission checks, such as the effective UID, GID, and supplementary group list.

item.title: HTTP Strict Transport Security(HSTS)
item.description:
HSTS is an opt-in security specified by a web application through the use of a special response header.

When the browser receives this header, the browser prevents all communication over HTTP to that specified domain. Instead the browser will send all communication over HTTPS.

item.title: Denial of Service(DoS): Attacks and Mitigation
item.description:
2016 saw 71% rise in Denial of Service attacks with biggest attack of 623 Gbps and mega attacks averaging around 100 Gbps.

If unprepared, Denial of Service can result in Financial losses, Reputational Damage, Customer Attrition and Legal Pursuits.
